job_title: Medical Assistant in Hilton Head Island, SC
pros: The Leadership was great at times.
cons: Ability to grow was a set back.

job_title: CT Technologist in Hilton Head Island, SC
pros: It is an overall easy job.

pros: Great co workers are the only reason I stayed for years! Good health insurance plans
cons: Poor management Lack of educational opportunities No room for advancement Lack of speciality providers and lack of resources

job_title: Medical Technologist in Hilton Head Island, SC

review_title: flexible and understanding with school schedule
job_title: Student Nurse Extern in Bluffton, SC
pros:
Always willing to work with my school schedule
Float Pool offers a variety of work experience
Staff nurses love working with nurse externs
continued annual training
cons: Many days are short staffed and it leaves you working with a clinical team that is frustrated and tired

job_title: Physician in Hilton Head Island, SC
pros: Hilton Head Island itself.  As a resort community there are abundant recreational activities to partake.
cons: Employed physician are treated with almost total disrespect on a day to day basis.  I, on too many accounts, have seen when physicians are involved in a hospital law suit, the physician is left out to dry when they are usually innocent of any wrong doing.  I am planning to leave as soon as possible before this can happen to me. I like most physicians practice good diligent medicine and do not need this injustice happening to me and/or my career.

job_title: Cst in Hilton Head Island, SC
pros: Management was involved in the everyday running of the OR. She would come in and mop when she needed to. Always willing to pitch in and help get cases going.
cons: Like most hospital out there trying to do more with less staff.
